description: The road is well kept and relatively free of vermon and debris, as
the city of Mirabar takes pride in its holdings.  It is a large city
built on the precious metal trade, as the Mines of Mirabar at the Wall
of the World pump wealth into her economy.
51435.name: {8Across the {wG{yr{ca{yg{ws {c>{8-{WT{whe {WL{wong {WR{woad{8-{c<{x

description: {y
This small room seems to be purposefully hidden as
if someone was trying to guard a secret.  A tavern
girl stands at the center of the room.  Around her
are many different kinds of golden dragons, from a
large painting above the fireplace, to several toy
figurines and drawings-all of golden dragons. It's
quite evident that the tavern girl has an interest.{x
51441.name: {9A {BSmall {CR{coom {8Hidden {xBehind the {YW{yall{x

description: On the open stretch of the Long Road, you can see the peaks of the
Sword Mountains to the west, and the fields of the Dessarin Grasslands
to the east.  The High Road runs far to the west along the other side
of the mountains, and far to the east is the dense forests of Ardeep.
51557.name: {8Open Road {c>{8-{WT{whe {WL{wong {WR{woad{8-{c<{x

description: Just inside the hamlet, there is pretty much nothing here.  A few
farms line the small dirt square, with the larger buildings to the
north and south, including the famous inn of these parts.  A drunk
staggers out of her doors, which is a sure sign of a quality
establishment if you ever saw one.  There is a small stream which runs
east into a dense patch of fog and darkness.
51563.name: {cR{wa{css{wa{cl{wa{cnt{wa{cr {wS{yquare{x

description: {cYou walk along deep inside the Swamp Bog with no way to gauge which
way is which.  Perhaps instinct and a bit of blind luck will help you
out of this ordeal.  {x
51487.name: {RL{rost {wWithin {8the {yS{wt{8u{wm{yp {cB{8o{tg{x

description: Just north of Rassalantar, the Long Road curves to the northeast to
such places as Amphail, Red Larch, and Westbridge.  This is perhaps
the safest portion of the Long Road, as Waterdeep guards keep closely
spaced patrols here, being stationed in the hamlet.
51521.name: {8The Open Road {c>{8-{WT{whe {WL{wong {WR{woad{8-{c<{x

description: The broad, dusty Long Road streches out before you, well traveled
by merchants and farmers on their way to markets along the way.  The
occasional adventurer also travels here, on his way to adventures and
lost treasure in the wilderness of the North.  West of you you can see
the northern end of the Sword Mountains, and to the east is nothing
but hills
51533.name: {8The Open Road {c>{8-{WT{whe {WL{wong {WR{woad{8-{c<{x

description: {cThis swamp is like no other.  Take the nastiest swamp you've ever
seen and add that upon itself about a dozen times, then you'll be
close to what this place is.  There is nothing dry here, as the air
saturates everything with a damp film of muck.  On top of this, any
light which may find its way in here is lost amidst the fog, making it
forever dark and dreary.  {x
51467.name: {8The {yS{wt{8u{wm{yp {cB{8o{tg{x

description: Rassalantar is a caravan watering stop along the road.  It is
nothing but a spring-fed pond surrounded by half a dozen walled farms
and an inn.  The pond drains into a stream to the east that empties
into The Stump Bog, a sprawling desolate marsh, haunted by monsters.
The ever-present fog and the nearby bog makes the hamlet a unpleasant
campsite.  The inn 'The Golden Dragon' lies to the east and to the
west is a small strip of trees known as the Keep Woods, located
between two farms.  The Long Road continues to the north and south.
51507.name: {8Road through {cR{wa{css{wa{cl{wa{cnt{wa{cr H{wa{cml{we{ct{x

description: The terrain is a bit rough, though the Long Road cuts a clear, flat
path through it.  Along either side of the road are rock outcrops and
sloping hills.  Towering to the northwest is the Sword Mountains,
which casts an ominous shadow over the flatlands to the east.
51511.name: {8Near the Mountains {c>{8-{WT{whe {WL{wong {WR{woad{8-{c<{x

description: This part of the hamlet is lined with, yes you guessed it, farms.
All but the large stone building to the east, which is complete with
an iron plated door.  Some horses stand lined along the northern side,
suggesting it is a barracks of some sort.
51566.name: {cR{wa{css{wa{cl{wa{cnt{wa{cr{x

description: {gA few stones jut from the blanket of leaves in this part of the
forest.  There looks to be a dropoff to the west where the trees are
much shorter.  It is difficult to discern direction this far into the
woods, though you think you are fairly far from the main road by now.
{x
51409.name: {wW{ci{8th{ci{wn {GKe{gep {cW{goo{Gds{x

description: {cThere are several trees scattered throughout the bog, though they
are suffering as the marsh water strangles them to death.  A few trees
have fallen and long rotted away, contributing to the stench and slimy
water that floats with green algae.  A few paces north is a wall of
trees.  {x
51468.name: {8The {yS{wt{8u{wm{yp {cB{8o{tg{x

description: {x
|  {BT{boday's {BG{bame{c:      {WC{wubes {8of {RC{rhance    {w|
|   {MR{mules{c:                               {w|
|      {gChance Cubes have six sides       {w|
|      {geach. There are four different    {w|
|      {gcolors, two red sides, two        {w|
|      {ggreen sides, one black and one    {w|
|      {gwhite.  Payout is as follows:     {w|
|           {RRed   {c:   {RLose               {w|
|           {GGreen {c:   {gBreak Even         {w|
|           {8Black {c:   {r????               {w|
|           {WWhite {c:   {GDouble Win         {w|
|  {cSuglios plays by traditional rules:   {w|
|  {cOne cube at a time, even drop, and    {w|
|  {cit counts where it lands. Good Luck!  {w|
{g
This small tent is dimly illuminated with a lantern hanging
from the center support.  Along the sides are several boxes
which are fastened with locks.  At the center sits a little
table draped in green cloth and a man sits behind it with a
grin. The tent is such that barely two people can fit in it
comfortably. A sign hangs on the table next to a crate seat.{x
51529.name: {CS{cuglios' {GH{gouse {xof {RC{rhance{x

description: The road inclines slightly here as it traverses some fairly rough terrain.
The peak of Mount Helimbrar rises not far to the north, and to the east are
the the flat Dessarin Grasslands.
51556.name: {8Open Road {c>{8-{WT{whe {WL{wong {WR{woad{8-{c<{x

description: The Long Road remains the vein of trade for goods in and out of
Mirabar, but for metals and stone, the river is preferred.  As most
merchants cannot afford the high cost of magically floating the heavy
stones down the river, they continue to use this archaic form of
travel to keep their pockets full.
51436.name: {8Across the {wG{yr{ca{yg{ws {c>{8-{WT{whe {WL{wong {WR{woad{8-{c<{x

description: Near the Village of Amphail, the smell of food and commerce
intermingle with the stench of livestock and farms.  Amphail is a good
sized village of around 600 or so, but in these trying times, it's
rather difficult to obtain an accurate census of the nearby
settlements, so that number is a good guess at best.
51561.name: {8South of {wAmphail Village {c>{8-{WT{whe {WL{wong {WR{woad{8-{c<{x

description: {w
The trees of the forest surround the Keep, as a clearing in
the canopy rises directly above.  One of the fears that was
addressed when it was built long ago was that enemies would
fall nearby trees as climbing posts and so all were removed.{x
51495.name: {wT{8he {ySh{gat{8t{ger{yed {cK{8ee{cp {8of {cR{wa{css{wa{cl{wa{cnt{wa{cr{x

description: {gThe tall trees overshadow the woods in a dark canopy, which gives
them almost an ominous feel.  Though they call these woods, they seem
more like a forest in density, though perhaps woods are named more for
their size than their content.  {x
51572.name: {wW{ci{8th{ci{wn {GKe{gep {cW{goo{Gds{x

description: The broad, dusty Long Road stretches out before you, well traveled
by merchants and farmers on their way to markets along the way.  The
occasional adventurer also travels here, on his way to adventures and
lost treasure in the wilderness of the North.  To the south the road
goes through a small town.
51538.name: {8The Open Road {c>{8-{WT{whe {WL{wong {WR{woad{8-{c<{x

description: The hilly Grags stretch far to the southwest and northeast and
obstruct your view on both sides.  The road curves around, also making
it difficult to see what's ahead or behind.  With only the sky to
guide you, you have a fairly good sense of direction.
51432.name: {8Across the {wG{yr{ca{yg{ws {c>{8-{WT{whe {WL{wong {WR{woad{8-{c<{x

description: To the west are endless flatlands with craggy foothills far on the
horizon.  To the east are some closer foothills, and you can make out
a forest to the northeast, though from here it looks to be just
another green mass.
51415.name: {8The Open Road {c>{8-{WT{whe {WL{wong {WR{woad{8-{c<{x

description: {cDeep within the Stump Bogs, you see more of the same as before.  In
all directions, the bogs stretch for miles.  This is perhaps the
deepest they go, and the foul creatures which inhabit this place bear
testament to their wretchedness.  There is no sky, for all of the fog
and overgrowth conceals any trace of one.  {x
51475.name: {wDeep {8in the {yS{wt{8u{wm{yp {cB{8o{tg{x

description: {gLooking around, you see trees, leaves, a few critters, and more
trees.  Pretty much what you would expect.  If you're looking for
something in particular, then maybe you're out of luck.  {x
51570.name: {wW{ci{8th{ci{wn {GKe{gep {cW{goo{Gds{x

description: The watering pond empties into this small stream, which meanders to
the east into the dense fog of a nearby bog.  The sounds of frogs and
insects grow louder further east, and to the west the faint trace of
the Long Road can be seen.
51446.name: {WF{wollowing {8A {CS{ct{8re{ca{Cm{x

description: Here, the large stone bridge crosses the River Mirar as it runs
from the Endless Ice Sea far to the northeast, to the Sea of Swords
and Luskan to the southwest.  It is this same river which affords the
prosperous trade of stone from the Mirabar Mines, and maintains this
city as the richest northern settlement on the continent.
51439.name: {8Across the {BRiver Mirar {c>{8-{WT{whe {WL{wong {WR{woad{8-{c<{x

description: This small watchtower is where the lone guard is stationed.  He is
rather bored here, as there hasn't been an assault on Waterdeep
territories in many years.
51585.name: {wLong Road {GW{gatchtower{x

description: This large clearing grows lushly with wild grass and flowers as
young trees begin to spring up from the ground, recovering from many
seasons of harvests.  A few paces into the field stands a large circle
of stones, and around it the ground is packed barren and flat from
heavy foot traffic.  The stones vary from 3 to 5 paces in height,
requiring a large number of orcs or even giants to move.  Upon closer
inspection, the stones seem to be buried only a few breadths deep, and
several are suspended upon their short end, such that their weight
along would normally make them unstable.  Each is painted with many
runes, that glow faintly in the shadows, suggesting they are enchanted
with magic, which may also explain their precarious balance among the
ring.  The circle of stones is warm, calm, and almost inviting for a
passive observer.
51587.name: A {Gfield {xoff the {Wm{wain {Wr{woad{x

description: At the end of the hallway are two doors, no doubt the
two rooms which this place consists of. They are made
of the same timbers as the rest of this place, but with
iron hardware that at least seems sturdy enough to keep
out the riff raff.  Above each is painted a little sign:
{x
{c                  /\        {CRoom Two
{C                Room One        {c-----/
51552.name: {yBack of {YThe Sle{yep{Ying {YDr{yag{Yon{x

description: Endless stretches of grasslands are to the east, with a faint hint
of forests far into the continent.  To the west, is a fairly large
forest that's within a day's walk from the road.  Behind it, the dark
peaks of the Sword Mountains rise to the heavens.
51414.name: {8Along the {gGrasslands {c>{8-{WT{whe {WL{wong {WR{woad{8-{c<{x

description: Just outside of the Village of Amphail, there are a few farms and
small buildings, though nothing of interest worth a stop for.
Northward, the Long Road leads to the settlement known as Red Larch
and further north is the likes of Westbridge, Triboar and Longsaddle.
51513.name: {8North of {wAmphail Village {c>{8-{WT{whe {WL{wong {WR{woad{8-{c<{x

description: This is a small tunnel that seems to have been dug by hand.  It
leads west from here.
51442.name: {8a small tunnel{x

description: The road goes through the southern foothills of the mountain range
known as the Sword Mountains, and makes it's way along the east side
of the mountains.  It makes a bend here and leads east to the hamlet
of Rassalantar and south to where it meets the High Road.
51505.name: {8Near the Mountains {c>{8-{WT{whe {WL{wong {WR{woad{8-{c<{x

description: {cThe boggy marsh makes a slight incline here, coming to a somewhat
dry patch of earth.  Remnants of an ancient campfire still remain, but
anything else has long been reclaimed by the bog.  To the east the way
descends back down into the depths of the Stump Bog.  {x
51464.name: {wDeep {8in the {yS{wt{8u{wm{yp {cB{8o{tg{x

description: The Long Road continues north and south, connecting the Xantharis
Keep to the southern settlements.  Within Lurkwood lies the settlement
of Grundwald, where the more civilized of the Uthgardt people.  There,
one will be welcome and find refuge from the dangers all around.
51421.name: {8Near {gL{yu{grkw{yoo{gd {GF{gorest {c>{8-{WT{whe {WL{wong {WR{woad{8-{c<{x

description: Walking the Long Road, you pass a few travelers and some strange
sites along the road, including remnants of campsites, busted carts,
and horse carcasses.  As close to safety as anywhere else, there is
still a lot to be weary about when traversing the Long Road.
51553.name: {8Near the Mountains {c>{8-{WT{whe {WL{wong {WR{woad{8-{c<{x

description: This crumbling passage leads to the high walls of the Keep.
It is there that defenders once fended off the enemies for
the protection of their own way of life.  Here, there is a
spiral stone stepway carved in the walls, somewhat damaged.{x
51490.name: {wBeneath {8the {cK{8ee{cp {8of {cR{wa{css{wa{cl{wa{cnt{wa{cr{x

description: At the far end of the passage is a small stepway leading up
to the overlook, which is the only surviving remains of the
once glorious Keep.  All but this passage has been caved in.{x
51491.name: {wBeneath {8the {cK{8ee{cp {8of {cR{wa{css{wa{cl{wa{cnt{wa{cr{x

description: The road is well packed and hard from centuries of traffic, though
never in those years was it ever set with cobblestones.  Only the
roads near the City of Spendors is so fortunate to be done up in
stone, for this far north, the roads come out of necessity rather than
comfort.
51404.name: {8The Open Road {c>{8-{WT{whe {WL{wong {WR{woad{8-{c<{x

description: {cThe swamp touches the edge of a forest of trees here.  The sounds
of the bog are not as pronounced here, and there is a faint sound of
rushing water nearby.  To the east, there are signs of something else
not filled with stench or darkness.  {x
51478.name: {8The {yS{wt{8u{wm{yp {cB{8o{tg{x

description: The Long Road reaches the base of the hilly range known as the
Grags.  In the past, precious ore was mined from them, though now
interest has shifted to the northern Spine, which many say bleeds with
riches.  The Grags are mostly under the protectorate of Mirabar to the
north, so any unauthorized mining here will carry with it high
punishment.
51437.name: {8Near the {wG{yr{ca{yg{ws {c>{8-{WT{whe {WL{wong {WR{woad{8-{c<{x

description: This is a barren room, with a small bed, a table, and a pile of hay
in the corner for perhaps animals or as a second bed for those that
double up.  It's not much, but then again, neither was the price.
51555.name: {yRoom {COne {yof the {YSle{yep{Ying Dr{yag{Yon {R[{WSAFE{R]{x

description: This long stretch of the long road is where perhaps it gets its
name.  Those who undertake this stretch often devote a full day or two
depending on if they're on foot or not.  While there is little brush
for robbers to hide along the side, they are still out and about, and
the further from Waterdeep one travels, the more likely they are to be
found.
51413.name: {8Along the {gGrasslands {c>{8-{WT{whe {WL{wong {WR{woad{8-{c<{x

description: The broad, dusty Long Road streches out before you, well traveled
by merchants and farmers on their way to markets along the way.  The
occasional adventurer also travels here, on his way to adventures and
lost treasure in the wilderness of the North.  You travel between the
northern foothills of the Sword Mountains to the west and rough hills
to the east.
51535.name: {8The Open Road {c>{8-{WT{whe {WL{wong {WR{woad{8-{c<{x

description: {cEchoes of screams from monsters can be heard all around.  The
waters are foul and covered with a layer of green muck that moves to
the bubbling gases and creatures which stir it.  Every move is
painful, for the bogs take with it both life and will, and leave its
victims the feelings of sorrow and despair.  {x
51471.name: {8The {yS{wt{8u{wm{yp {cB{8o{tg{x

description: The broad, dusty Long Road stretches out before you, well traveled
by merchants and farmers on their way to markets along the way.  The
occasional adventurer also travels here, on his way to adventures and
lost treasure in the wilderness of the North.
51539.name: {8The Open Road {c>{8-{WT{whe {WL{wong {WR{woad{8-{c<{x

description: The Long Road bends again on it's way through the foothills between
Rassalantar and Amphail, leading west and north from here.  The broad,
dusty road is easy to travel, and you meet other travelers on their
way to or from Waterdeep.  You also meet the occasional group of
Waterdeep Guards, patroling the road between Amphail and Waterdeep.
51509.name: {8Near the Mountains {c>{8-{WT{whe {WL{wong {WR{woad{8-{c<{x

description: {y The small path off the Long Road leads toward a group of tents
stakes around several horse drawn carts.  There is a rather tall man
standing outside of the big one holding a gnarled cane that he waves
to passing travelers in hope of drawing a few near.  It would seem
that it worked, at least in your case.  {x
51592.name: {yA {gP{8ath {yoff the {WMain R{woad{x

description: The broad, dusty Long Road streches out before you, well traveled
by merchants and farmers on their way to markets along the way.  The
occasional adventurer also travels here, on his way to adventures and
lost treasure in the wilderness of the North.  You travel between the
northern foothills of the Sword Mountains to the west and rough hills
to the east.
51534.name: {8The Open Road {c>{8-{WT{whe {WL{wong {WR{woad{8-{c<{x

description: {cThe smell of foul odors saturate the air in the Stump Bog.  If it
weren't for the dense fog, you could imagine endless rows of dead tree
stumps rotting away in the putrid waters.  It is a brave individual
indeed who chooses to set foot in such a place.  {x
51451.name: {8The {yS{wt{8u{wm{yp {cB{8o{tg{x

description: {gThe leaves scatter to your stride as even centuries could not keep
them in one place.  There are birds and creatures all about,
suggesting this is not an ominous place.  Looking far to the
northwest, you can scarcely make out the peaks of the Sword Mountains,
though from here they look like nothing more than dark points in the
sky.  {x
51573.name: {wW{ci{8th{ci{wn {GKe{gep {cW{goo{Gds{x

description: {w
The outlook looks deep into the forest, as birds and small
creatures echo their movements to this height. It is about
a good 12 feet from the forest floor with overhanging side
murder holes to hold archers. Climbing up it is impossible.{x
51492.name: {wT{8he {ySh{gat{8t{ger{yed {cK{8ee{cp {8of {cR{wa{css{wa{cl{wa{cnt{wa{cr{x

description: The broad, dusty Long Road streches out before you, well traveled
by merchants and farmers on their way to markets along the way.  The
occasional adventurer also travels here, on his way to adventures and
lost treasure in the wilderness of the North.  West of the road lies
the northern edge of Kryptgarden and to the east is a large area of
hills
51531.name: {8The Open Road {c>{8-{WT{whe {WL{wong {WR{woad{8-{c<{x

description: {y
This room is a nice quiet spot far removed from the rest of
the commotion.  A few lamps hang from the lumber walls here
and there is a small vent that links the fireplace to here,
giving this place warmth regardless of how cold it gets out
and about. Not only is this lodge a comfortable place to be,
it offers up protection from would be thieves and predators.{x
51590.name: {8A {mBack {BRoom {8of the {yLodge{x

description: {gThe trees grow big here, despite their proximity to the mountains
to the west.  Near to the Keep, the trees are younger, as all of the
old trees were long ago removed to keep invaders off the outlook.  {x
51577.name: {wFar {wW{ci{8th{ci{wn {GKe{gep {cW{goo{Gds{x

description: {gInside the woods are all manner of creatures, but nothing that
would otherwise not be expected to dwell in a forest.  You do no see
much of interest here, but then again, you didn't expect to find this
place to begin with.  {x
51569.name: {wW{ci{8th{ci{wn {GKe{gep {cW{goo{Gds{x

description: {cThe sounds of many things echo through the marshes, almost
deafening at times where it is hard to even hear yourself moving.  The
stories you have heard of thieves hiding out in this place are even
less believable now that you've seen it.  But despite the noise, you
know the real dangers only come with everything falls silent.  {x
51473.name: {8The {yS{wt{8u{wm{yp {cB{8o{tg{x

description: {GThis large field of crops is encircled by several farms which share
ownership of the nearby farmlands in and around Rassalantar Hamlet.
Many different kinds of crops grow here, all bunched together yet
still remain segregated.  There is a farmer here tending his field.  {x
51586.name: {xa {Gfield {xof {gc{yr{Yo{yp{gs{x

description: {gInside the woods are all manner of creatures, but nothing that
would otherwise not be expected to dwell in a forest.  You do no see
much of interest here, but then again, you didn't expect to find this
place to begin with.  {x
51578.name: {wFar {wW{ci{8th{ci{wn {GKe{gep {cW{goo{Gds{x

description: The road curves slightly here as you near a dense forest at your
east.  The Long Road extends as far as the eye can see to the south,
and to the north, the road curves into some hill country.
51416.name: {8Nearing {gL{yu{grkw{yoo{gd {GF{gorest {c>{8-{WT{whe {WL{wong {WR{woad{8-{c<{x

description: The broad, dusty Long Road stretches out before you, well traveled
by merchants and farmers on their way to markets along the way.  The
occasional adventurer also travels here, on his way to adventures and
lost treasure in the wilderness of the North.  To the west you see
rolling hills, but to the east is only vast plains.
51547.name: {8Near the {yFoothills {c>{8-{WT{whe {WL{wong {WR{woad{8-{c<{x

description: {cThe Stump Bog comes to a wall of trees here on its southern
outskirts.  To the east and west, the bog extends for miles, and it
doesn't seem to be much comfort to know that one cannot enter the
trees for safety.  To the north is more endless bog.  Oh goodie.  {x
51458.name: {8The {yS{wt{8u{wm{yp {cB{8o{tg{x

description: This is a rather small inn set up along the Long Road.  It is more
of a barn than a quality establishment, but those who have been denied
the luxuries of the City of Splendors, be it for personal hygiene or
morals, they can find a decent night's sleep here and a bite to eat as
well.
51551.name: {YThe Sle{yep{Ying Dr{yag{Yon{0

description: {cDeeper into the Stump Bog is more dangerous creatures and nasty
waters.  The water bubbles with swamp gas and splashes with the sounds
of small creatures.  {cThe stench is near unbearable, and if you have
any second thoughts about going back, now's the time to decide.  {x
51459.name: {8The {yS{wt{8u{wm{yp {cB{8o{tg{x

description: This northern stretch of the Long Road is particularly dangerous
and even more so during the winter months when wolves and orcs are
more desperate for food.  Few patrols go out in these parts, as most
bring along their own protection.
51424.name: {8Near {gL{yu{grkw{yoo{gd {GF{gorest {c>{8-{WT{whe {WL{wong {WR{woad{8-{c<{x

description: The broad, dusty Long Road streches out before you, well traveled
by merchants and farmers on their way to markets along the way.  The
occasional adventurer also travels here, on his way to adventures and
lost treasure in the wilderness of the North.  Here the road goes
along the edge of a large area of hills to the east, and to the west
lies vast open plains.
51524.name: {8The Open Road {c>{8-{WT{whe {WL{wong {WR{woad{8-{c<{x

description: The broad, dusty Long Road streches out before you, well traveled
by merchants and farmers on their way to markets along the way.  The
occasional adventurer also travels here, on his way to adventures and
lost treasure in the wilderness of the North.  Here the road goes
along the edge of a large area of hills to the east, and to the west
lies vast open plains.
51523.name: {8The Open Road {c>{8-{WT{whe {WL{wong {WR{woad{8-{c<{x

description: The Long Road leads to the northeast, where it intersects
settlements such as Amphail, Red Larch, Longsaddle, Westbridge, and
the illustrious Mirabar far to the north at the spine of the world.
Riches can be gleamed to those few who can make that journey and back.
51503.name: {8Open Road {c>{8-{WT{whe {WL{wong {WR{woad{8-{c<{x

description: Standing just north of Xantharl Keep, you find yourself near the
Grags to the north as the Long Road cuts jagged turns and sharp
inclines into them.  For those with the time and energy to brave this
final stretch of the Long Road, the city of Mirabar awaits.
51428.name: {8North of {wX{ga{cnt{8ha{rrl{8's {cKe{ge{wp {c>{8-{WT{whe {WL{wong {WR{woad{8-{c<{x

description: {cPerhaps the stale air wouldn't be as bad if there were an
occasional breeze but it remains stagnant and suffocating.  With each
step, you can feel your life being drained away as the bog takes it
from you.  If the monsters here don't kill you, the bog surely will.  {x
51465.name: {wDeep {8in the {yS{wt{8u{wm{yp {cB{8o{tg{x

description: {cThis is the foul likes of the Stump Bog.  Why you even decided to
enter here is a mystery, for the monsters would surely attack at first
sight of an intruder.  The edge of the swamp is here, with the foul
stench of swamp gas bubbling from the fetid waters.  {x
51448.name: {8The {yS{wt{8u{wm{yp {cB{8o{tg{x

description: On this open stretch of nothing, there is a sense of lonliness, but
immense freedom from the bustle of civilization.  The occasional
carrion bird will swoop overhead in search of some food, or perhaps in
hope that you will become food.  Maybe if one gets close enough, there
will be some sport in killing it.
51405.name: {8The Open Road {c>{8-{WT{whe {WL{wong {WR{woad{8-{c<{x

description: The road into the Grags continues northwest, and the road exits
them to the southeast.  Along the roadside, one can catch the
occasional glimpse of a busted cart or dead horse carcass, now long
picked clean by carrion birds and wolves.  It is no wonder few choose
to travel this road alone.
51431.name: {8Across the {wG{yr{ca{yg{ws {c>{8-{WT{whe {WL{wong {WR{woad{8-{c<{x

description: The Grags begin here as the road is rocky and mountainous to tread.
Even so, the centuries of trade traffic have made it bearable, and
scoured its trace against the world.  The winding incline of the road
to the northwest is anything but inviting.  To the south, the walls of
Xantharl's Keep can be seen.
51430.name: {8Across the {wG{yr{ca{yg{ws {c>{8-{WT{whe {WL{wong {WR{woad{8-{c<{x

description: {cYou walk along deep inside the Swamp Bog with no way to gauge which
way is which.  Perhaps instinct and a bit of blind luck will help you
out of this ordeal.  {x
51483.name: {RL{rost {wWithin {8the {yS{wt{8u{wm{yp {cB{8o{tg{x

description: The Long Road approaches the Lurkwood Forest to the east, which is
one of the larger forests on the continent, full of peril and
adventure for one so inclined.  This long stretch of road can get very
dangerous at night, and especially in the winter months.
51417.name: {8Nearing {gL{yu{grkw{yoo{gd {GF{gorest {c>{8-{WT{whe {WL{wong {WR{woad{8-{c<{x

description: The broad, dusty Long Road streches out before you, well traveled
by merchants and farmers on their way to markets along the way.  The
occasional adventurer also travels here, on his way to adventures and
lost treasure in the wilderness of the North.  To the south the road
goes through a small village, to the west lies the northern edge of
Kryptgarden and to the east is a large area of hills
51530.name: {8North of {wMidgaard {c>{8-{WT{whe {WL{wong {WR{woad{8-{c<{x

description: {gInterestingly enough, no one mentioned that these woods actually
had something to them.  The brush is very thick and the trees tower to
dizzying heights, which is rather peculiar for these parts.  {x
51562.name: {wW{ci{8th{ci{wn {GKe{gep {cW{goo{Gds{x

description: Perhaps it is stretches like this that give the Long Road its name.
The walks are long and quiet, and there is little to see than a far
stretch of forest and flat grasslands.  Such stretches are a haven for
criminals and wild animals, so experienced travelers are well
knowledgeable in where safe havens lie.
51420.name: {8Near {gL{yu{grkw{yoo{gd {GF{gorest {c>{8-{WT{whe {WL{wong {WR{woad{8-{c<{x

description: This is an open stretch of the Long Road.  To the north stands the
grand gates of Mirabar just across the River Mirar.  To the south
stretches the hilly Grags, where the Long Road cuts southward all the
way to Waterdeep.  The road is clean and well kept, being in the care
of Mirabar.
51438.name: {8The Open Road {c>{8-{WT{whe {WL{wong {WR{woad{8-{c<{x

description: The Long Road continues to the north and south, cutting slighty to
the west as it leads northward, and opening into a fairly large
settlement directly south.  A few farms are scattered about as the
scenery opens up to vast stretches of flatlands and patches of
foothills.
51400.name: {8North of {BLongsaddle {c>{8-{WT{whe {WL{wong {WR{woad{8-{c<{x

description: {cThe swamp air is making you nauseous.  The worse part is there is
no easy way to find fresh air, and at this state, your fighting
abilities are serously hindered.  But such thoughts only contribute to
your inabilities, so it is best to soldier on and continue your
journey through the marsh.  {x
51450.name: {wDeep {8in the {yS{wt{8u{wm{yp {cB{8o{tg{x

description: Further down the stream, you near the infamous Stump Bog, which is
a desolate patch of marsh that the unfortunate residence of
Rassalantar live near.  Rumors of monsters and the undead circulate
about this bog, so unless you have an wild hair for adventure, turning
back would be a wise option.
51463.name: {8Nearing the {yS{wt{8u{wm{yp {cB{8o{tg{x

description: {8There are a few tufts of dead grass, but otherwise the ground is
completely barren, having been kicked up by some unpronounced force.
There are several of the larger poles standing at odd angles ready to
be knocked over, and a couple already have been felled.  {x
51595.name: {WI{8nside {xa {RL{rarge {YT{yent{x

description: The broad, dusty Long Road stretches out before you, well traveled
by merchants and farmers on their way to markets along the way.  The
occasional adventurer also travels here, on his way to adventures and
lost treasure in the wilderness of the North.  To the west you see
rolling hills, but to the east is only vast plains.  Up ahead to the
north is a small town.
51549.name: {8Near the {yFoothills {c>{8-{WT{whe {WL{wong {WR{woad{8-{c<{x

description: The Long Road makes its final stretch northward as it cuts into the
hilly terrain of the Grags.  For those many who cross this last
avenue, riches await them in the city of Mirabar, regarded as the
richest city north of Waterdeep.
51429.name: {8Near the {wG{yr{ca{yg{ws {c>{8-{WT{whe {WL{wong {WR{woad{8-{c<{x

description: The broad, dusty Long Road stretches out before you, well traveled
by merchants and farmers on their way to markets along the way.  The
occasional adventurer also travels here, on his way to adventures and
lost treasure in the wilderness of the North.  To the west you see
rolling hills, but to the east is only vast plains.
51544.name: {8The Open Road {c>{8-{WT{whe {WL{wong {WR{woad{8-{c<{x

description: {cFew have dared to journey this deep into the bogs, for fear of
meeting up with something they cannot handle.  The words of arcane
have little influence here.  Gods, they do not see in such places.  It
is the triumph of your own spirit that will see you through this
ordeal.  {x
51476.name: {8The {yS{wt{8u{wm{yp {cB{8o{tg{x

description: The road just goes on and on through the rolling hills, leading
almost straight north-south here.  West across the plains lies the
southers edge of the Westwood and beyond that lies the Sword
Mountains.
51515.name: {8Along the {gGrasslands {c>{8-{WT{whe {WL{wong {WR{woad{8-{c<{x

description: This small tunnel continues west to who knows where.
51443.name: {8a small tunnel{x

description: The broad, dusty Long Road stretches out before you, well traveled
by merchants and farmers on their way to markets along the way.  The
occasional adventurer also travels here, on his way to adventures and
lost treasure in the wilderness of the North.  To the west you see
rolling hills, but to the east is only vast plains.
51548.name: {8Near the {yFoothills {c>{8-{WT{whe {WL{wong {WR{woad{8-{c<{x

description: Passing the dark forests of Lurkwood, you hear strange sounds of
animals, and perhaps humanoids lurking within.  To the west, the
grasslands end abruptly as a large range of craggy hills rise further
northwest.
51423.name: {8Near {gL{yu{grkw{yoo{gd {GF{gorest {c>{8-{WT{whe {WL{wong {WR{woad{8-{c<{x

description: Just north of the intersection where it meets with the High Road,
the Long Road cuts though the plains on its long and dusty way into
the northern wilderness.  Looming above you to the north you see the
tall peeks of the Sword Mountains.  South of you lies the last
civilization for a while in the form of the grand city Waterdeep.
51504.name: {8Near the Mountains {c>{8-{WT{whe {WL{wong {WR{woad{8-{c<{x

description: {cThe air is foul and saturated with the aura of death.  This deep
into the Stump Bog, one can expect some nasty surprises, as rumors of
the living dead and bands of orcs and lizardmen run rampant about this
place.  Another rumor is that this marsh is one of the favorite places
to dump murder victims.  {x
51466.name: {wDeep {8in the {yS{wt{8u{wm{yp {cB{8o{tg{x

description: {cThe fog drifts back and forth as if compelled in two directions at
once.  This illusion seems to be further enforced with the moving bog
water, which also exhibits the same effect.  The dense grouping of
trees makes the marsh dark even during the day, and at night, such an
expedition would be suicide.  {x
51453.name: {wDeep {8in the {yS{wt{8u{wm{yp {cB{8o{tg{x

description: The broad, dusty Long Road stretches out before you, well traveled
by merchants and farmers on their way to markets along the way.  The
occasional adventurer also travels here, on his way to adventures and
lost treasure in the wilderness of the North.  To the west you see
rolling hills, but to the east is only vast plains.
51546.name: {8Near the {yFoothills {c>{8-{WT{whe {WL{wong {WR{woad{8-{c<{x

description: {cThe dark recesses of the Stump Bog are ominous to all, perhaps even
to the undead which dwell this far in.  Dangers are everpresent and
the security that once accompanies the ability to escape at an
uttering of a word has long since disappeared.  This is the embodiment
of despair.  {x
51480.name: {8The {yS{wt{8u{wm{yp {cB{8o{tg{x

description: {cThere are many rows of rotting stumps and their roots tangle about
in the murky water, which makes it very easy to trip and fall here.
That is something you must not do, for a fall into these murky depths
would be a welcome call for all of the monsters within ear shot and
swimming distance.  Of course, if you were wise enough to enchant
yourself with fly, then things are much different.  {x
51456.name: {wDeep {8in the {yS{wt{8u{wm{yp {cB{8o{tg{x

description: This is a barren room, with a small bed, a table, and a pile of hay
in the corner for perhaps animals or as a second bed for those that
double up.  It's not much, but then again, neither was the price.
51568.name: {yRoom {CTwo {yof the {YSle{yep{Ying Dr{yag{Yon {R[{WSAFE{R]{x

description: The broad, dusty Long Road stretches out before you, well traveled
by merchants and farmers on their way to markets along the way.  The
occasional adventurer also travels here, on his way to adventures and
lost treasure in the wilderness of the North.
51541.name: {8The Open Road {c>{8-{WT{whe {WL{wong {WR{woad{8-{c<{x

description: {cThe fog lessens here, as you approach a wall of trees to the east.
All around you are rotting stumps of dead trees which the bog has
strangled, yet within a few paces the bog cannot touch those which
flourish in this damp environment.  The gnarled tangle of rotten roots
make treading this marsh very difficult.  {x
51479.name: {8The {yS{wt{8u{wm{yp {cB{8o{tg{x

description: The road just goes on and on through the rolling hills, leading
almost straight north-south here.  West across the plains lies the
Westwood and beyond that lies the Sword Mountains.  You meet other
travelers on your way, but the guards from Waterdeep don't patrol this
far north.
51516.name: {8Along the {gGrasslands {c>{8-{WT{whe {WL{wong {WR{woad{8-{c<{x

description: The descent into the northern valley begins here to the north, and
the Long Road reaches a high point just to the south.  Far down, the
illustrious town of Mirabar can be seen amidst a stretch of river.
Even this close to the city, there are surprisingly few patrols, which
makes the bodyguard business there very profitable.
51434.name: {8Across the {wG{yr{ca{yg{ws {c>{8-{WT{whe {WL{wong {WR{woad{8-{c<{x

description: South of Xantharl's Keep is surprisingly barren.  Unlike the
settlements to the south, there are no signs of farms or small
dwellings in the nearby country.  This is most likely due to the
inhospitable terrain as much as the dangers which lie all about.
51427.name: {8South of {wX{ga{cnt{8ha{rrl{8's {cKe{ge{wp {c>{8-{WT{whe {WL{wong {WR{woad{8-{c<{x

description: The stream continues here as it meanders slightly southward down
towards what you guess to be the Dressarin River to the east.  To the
far northeast you imagine seeing the walls of Sarcrag.  A few farms
are scattered about this small path along the river.
51447.name: {WF{wollowing {8A {CS{ct{8re{ca{Cm{x

description: The road goes through the southern foothills of the mountain range
known as the Sword Mountains, and makes it's way along the east side
of the mountains.  North of here you see the small hamlet of
Rassalantar, and the road to the west eventually leads to Waterdeep.
51506.name: {8South of {cR{wa{css{wa{cl{wa{cnt{wa{cr {c>{8-{WT{whe {WL{wong {WR{woad{8-{c<{x

description: You stand outside the eastern gates of the City of Spendors.
Stretching far to the north is the Long Road, one of the primary trade
routes to the city.  This road is well worn and well kept, as the
Lords and Nobles would have it no other way.  To the west stand the
massive city gates of Waterdeep, open yet heavily guarded.  The
eastern wall stretch north and south as far as the eye can see.
51500.name: {8Near Waterdeep {c>{8-{WT{whe {WL{wong {WR{woad{8-{c<{x

description: The Long Road goes through the hills here, and bends sligthly,
leading south and east from here.  To the east it goes a little bit
further into the hills, and to the south it leads to a low ridge and
the town of Red Larch.
51522.name: {8North of {RR{8e{rd {RL{8a{rrch {wVillage {c>{8-{WT{whe {WL{wong {WR{woad{8-{c<{x

description: {cThis section of the bog is isolated from the rest and separated by
a ring of trees that surprisingly are still alive.  The marsh water
gathers in pools here, and there is much more dry ground in this
little area than in the rest of the bog.  Perhaps it's a good place to
catch your breath.  {x
51472.name: {8The {yS{wt{8u{wm{yp {cB{8o{tg{x

description: Surrounded by a few walled farms, this small path leads to the edge
of {GKe{gep {cW{goo{Gds{x.  This is a dead end.
51558.name: {xAt the {wEdge {xof {GKe{gep {cW{goo{Gds{x

description: {cThe swamp muck saturates your clothing and the odor penetrates your
armor as you feel defiled somehow.  This is perhaps the worst as far
as swamps go, with near zero visibility and equal tolerance for the
putrid environment.  The swamp gets deeper further east from here, but
only someone with a death wish would attempt to wade it.  {x
51457.name: {8The {yS{wt{8u{wm{yp {cB{8o{tg{x

description: {gSouth of the Shattered Keep, the Keep Woods continue unabated.
This isolated section of wood seems serene and quiet, a bit different
from the eastern end and a lot more secluded.  {x
51580.name: {wW{ci{8th{ci{wn {GKe{gep {cW{goo{Gds{x

description: {cThe sounds of the swamp are loud and annoying.  Strange insects
chirping amidst the sounds of frogs and things splashing in the
shallow water.  Far off in the distance, you can almost discern the
moaning of the undead in torment.  But you invite these sounds, for
only when things become silent does true danger present itself.  {x
51454.name: {8The {yS{wt{8u{wm{yp {cB{8o{tg{x

description: Standing smack in the middle of the barracks of Waterdeep's Patrol
Guards takes some real guts, or lack of grey matter in your case.
There is what you would typically find in a well-kept barracks:
weapons, armor, and lots of guards, all the product of elite Waterdeep
training.  Perhaps if you have no business here, leaving would be a
good option.
51567.name: {BWa{bt{8e{wr{8d{be{Bep {cB{8arracks {c- {WL{wong {WR{woad {WP{watrol{x

description: The broad, dusty Long Road stretches out before you, well traveled
by merchants and farmers on their way to markets along the way.  The
occasional adventurer also travels here, on his way to adventures and
lost treasure in the wilderness of the North.  To the north the road
enters a small town.
51550.name: {8South of {BLongsaddle {c>{8-{WT{whe {WL{wong {WR{woad{8-{c<{x

description: To the north is a low ridge that serves as the westermost edge of
the hills to the northeast.  On top of the ridge lies the small town
known as Red Larch.  To the south you can see the weathered peaks of
the Sword Mountains.
51520.name: {8South of {RR{8e{rd {RL{8a{rrch {wVillage {c>{8-{WT{whe {WL{wong {WR{woad{8-{c<{x

description: The dusty road just goes on and on through the rolling hills,
leading almost straight north-south here.  Northeast of you you can
see large hills rise above the plains.  On the edge of the hills lies
a small village.  Southwest of you lies the Westwood at a distance.
51519.name: {8Along the {gGrasslands {c>{8-{WT{whe {WL{wong {WR{woad{8-{c<{x

description: The broad, dusty Long Road stretches out before you, well traveled
by merchants and farmers on their way to markets along the way.  The
occasional adventurer also travels here, on his way to adventures and
lost treasure in the wilderness of the North.  To the west is the
southern edge of a area of hills and the the east is nothing but vast
plains.
51543.name: {8The Open Road {c>{8-{WT{whe {WL{wong {WR{woad{8-{c<{x

description: This interesting little dwelling is carved out of a giant tree
stump and is full of junk.  The inhabitant, a stocky gnome, has a
fondness for metallic objects, as that is what occupies the bulk of
this room.  The gnome himself sits at the center among his many
creations, which probably don't even work.
51489.name: {wA {mS{8mall {YD{ywelling{x

description: {cThe swamp is deeper here, as each move further is just as strange
as the last.  Along all sides, there is the endless bog.  You must
take care to avoid the dead stumps and half felled trees which are all
about.  Worse are the snakes and other creatures which can descend on
you from above.  {x
51455.name: {8The {yS{wt{8u{wm{yp {cB{8o{tg{x

description: {cThe temperature in this swamp is warm, even in the winter months as
there is an unnatural life to this place.  Visibility is limited in
all directions, and you only hope that the sounds of the undead go
away as you tread further into the bog.  There is a wall of trees to
the east and north.  {x
51469.name: {8The {yS{wt{8u{wm{yp {cB{8o{tg{x

description: {y
There is a large, stone wall between you and a small room
where a husky human sits reading a book. Two sets of bars
keep you and him apart, perhaps for when a trade goes bad.
A sign hangs just beneath the window, listing the current
trade prices they pay for a select number of trophy items.{x
51591.name: {YT{yrade {BBooth{x

description: The ground is packed densely from the traffic of carts, horses, and
those many who choose to walk it on foot. While many dangers lie aong
its length, it is a relief to know that civilization lies just around
the corner.
51560.name: {8Open Road {c>{8-{WT{whe {WL{wong {WR{woad{8-{c<{x

description: This far north, only an occasional Waterdeep patrol can be seen.
Vast stretches of the Long Road continue with few patrons, and even
fewer signs of civilization.  To the east are endless fields of grass.
To the west, the Westwood Forest looms.
51412.name: {8Along the {gGrasslands {c>{8-{WT{whe {WL{wong {WR{woad{8-{c<{x

description: {cYou walk along deep inside the Swamp Bog with no way to gauge which
way is which.  Perhaps instinct and a bit of blind luck will help you
out of this ordeal.  {x
51486.name: {RL{rost {wWithin {8the {yS{wt{8u{wm{yp {cB{8o{tg{x

description: The broad, dusty Long Road streches out before you, well traveled
by merchants and farmers on their way to markets along the way.  The
occasional adventurer also travels here, on his way to adventures and
lost treasure in the wilderness of the North.  To the north the road
goes through a small village.
51528.name: {8South of {wMidgaard {c>{8-{WT{whe {WL{wong {WR{woad{8-{c<{x

description: The Long Road makes a bend here.  To the west you see the Sword
mountains in the distance.  Northwest of here the is the Westwood,
growing in the foothills of the mountains.
51514.name: {8Along the {gGrasslands {c>{8-{WT{whe {WL{wong {WR{woad{8-{c<{x

description: {cYou walk along deep inside the Swamp Bog with no way to gauge which
way is which.  Perhaps instinct and a bit of blind luck will help you
out of this ordeal.  {x
51485.name: {RL{rost {wWithin {8the {yS{wt{8u{wm{yp {cB{8o{tg{x

description: {gThe canopy of trees provide a natural shelter from the elements,
though not thick enough to be a complete barrier.  The trees gain age
further from the Keep one goes, and many are scarred from ancient wars
long fought.  {x
51582.name: {wW{ci{8th{ci{wn {GKe{gep {cW{goo{Gds{x

description: {gA few animals gather here as the Keep Woods provide for them all
they need.  This isolated part of the woods has not seen intruders for
many years, and these animals don't know what to do.  {x
51576.name: {wFar {wW{ci{8th{ci{wn {GKe{gep {cW{goo{Gds{x

description: To the west, nothing.  To the east, nothing.  The only real
solution is to head north or south and follow the Long Road out, as it
makes its way from settlement to settlement.  Far to the east are
sloping hills mixing with the plains and grasslands all about.
51401.name: {8The Open Road {c>{8-{WT{whe {WL{wong {WR{woad{8-{c<{x

description: On this monotonous and long stretch of the Long Road, there is
little to see that has yet to be seen.  Far to the east are some
foothills, and to the west as far as the eye can see are vast
stretches of nothing.  The open sky heralds an air of freedom, but
this is short lived as there is no protection from thieves and bandits
this far north.
51402.name: {8The Open Road {c>{8-{WT{whe {WL{wong {WR{woad{8-{c<{x

description: The flat terrain cuts into foothills on all sides.  The Long Road
continues southwest and northeast, connecting the inner settlements.
The small town of Triboar is directly south of here, and further north
there is vast stretches of nothing.
51537.name: {8North of {RT{rri{8b{yoa{Yr{x {c>{8-{WT{whe {WL{wong {WR{woad{8-{c<{x

description: {w
The far side of the Keep looks out over the western half of
the Keep Woods, where there is less of a chance of invasion.
Far above the canopy of trees, the sharp peaks of the Sword
Mountains rise with authority and shades the forest in dark.{x
51497.name: {wT{8he {ySh{gat{8t{ger{yed {cK{8ee{cp {8of {cR{wa{css{wa{cl{wa{cnt{wa{cr{x

description: {8Though large, this tent suffers from a lack of light and
unobstructed view, having places where the tarp sags down near to the
ground, while in other places the poles criss cross as they are nearly
dropped in what would appear to be some sort of commotion.  {x
51598.name: {WI{8nside {xa {RL{rarge {YT{yent{x

description: {yAt the front of this tent stands a tall animal keeper, as apparent
from his thick leather armor and holding chains that he has wrapped
all around himself.  There is no sign above this tent, and it would
appear that it is kept closed at all times, but the keeper does seem
to be noticing you.  Perhaps he will let you have a look.  {x
51593.name: {WB{8efore {xa {RL{rarge {YT{yent{x

description: The broad, dusty Long Road streches out before you, well traveled
by merchants and farmers on their way to markets along the way.  The
occasional adventurer also travels here, on his way to adventures and
lost treasure in the wilderness of the North.  To the north the road
enters a small town.
51536.name: {8South of {RT{rri{8b{yoa{Yr{x {c>{8-{WT{whe {WL{wong {WR{woad{8-{c<{x

description: The broad, dusty Long Road stretches out before you, well traveled
by merchants and farmers on their way to markets along the way.  The
occasional adventurer also travels here, on his way to adventures and
lost treasure in the wilderness of the North.
51540.name: {8The Open Road {c>{8-{WT{whe {WL{wong {WR{woad{8-{c<{x

description: The broad, dusty Long Road streches out before you, well traveled
by merchants and farmers on their way to markets along the way.  The
occasional adventurer also travels here, on his way to adventures and
lost treasure in the wilderness of the North.  The road is in the
northern edge of the hills here.  Far to the west you can see the
Kryptgarden Forest, and beyond that the Sword Mountains.
51526.name: {8Near the {yFoothills {c>{8-{WT{whe {WL{wong {WR{woad{8-{c<{x

description: {cThere are surprisingly few strong monsters here, despite the
reports which say otherwise.  To the east is endless bog, and to the
west you know it at least ends.  The water here isn't as deep as in
other places, which brings a solemn, yet brief, asylum from the
discomfort of this place.  {x
51460.name: {8The {yS{wt{8u{wm{yp {cB{8o{tg{x

description: {8This tent is kept dark and barren.  On all sides are raised a
series of large iron poles staked into the ground with crossing ropes
and chains to keep it all standing.  The dirt all around looks to be
dug up as if there was a fight or some other commotion, and it is
clear that whatever still lurks here isn't happy.  {x
51594.name: {WI{8nside {xa {RL{rarge {YT{yent{x

description: The broad, dusty Long Road streches out before you, well traveled
by merchants and farmers on their way to markets along the way.  The
occasional adventurer also travels here, on his way to adventures and
lost treasure in the wilderness of the North.  The road is in the
northern edge of the hills here.  Far to the west you can see the
Kryptgarden Forest, and beyond that the Sword Mountains.
51525.name: {8The Open Road {c>{8-{WT{whe {WL{wong {WR{woad{8-{c<{x

description: {gThe wind blows gently from the west, rustling the trees in a
synchronized dance of silent reverence.  Perhaps these ancient woods
haven't seen someone like you in many hundred years, for there seems
no signs that anyone else has intruded on them in recent times.  {x
51584.name: {wW{ci{8th{ci{wn {GKe{gep {cW{goo{Gds{x

description: The Grags lie just to the north behind a large Keep.  You are
within the view of their towers, and they are well aware of your
approach by now, though there would be no reason to be alarmed by the
likes of you.  A few travelers are near, but not quite as many as can
be seen further south.
51426.name: {8The Open Road {c>{8-{WT{whe {WL{wong {WR{woad{8-{c<{x

description: {cThe smell of decaying flesh and strong odors saturate the air,
bringing you near to vomiting.  This is perhaps the nastiest marsh you
have ever set your eyes upon, though it's quite evident that's where
the Stump Bog gets it's appeal.  {x
51452.name: {8The {yS{wt{8u{wm{yp {cB{8o{tg{x

description: The stream slows its descent down to the marsh as an ominous haze
blankets this area.  The path ends abruptly here as the stream
continues through some brush.  It is clear that few dare tread any
closer to the marsh, for doing so would challenge death to a duel.
51462.name: {WF{wollowing {8A {CS{ct{8re{ca{Cm{x

description: The Long Road extends from the gates of Waterdeep to the northeast,
where it connects to various settlements on the inner continent.  The
importance of this road for trade and communication is given testament
by the amount of traffic it endures.
51501.name: {8Near Waterdeep {c>{8-{WT{whe {WL{wong {WR{woad{8-{c<{x

description: {c You walk along deep inside the Swamp Bog with no way to gauge
which way is which.  Perhaps instinct and a bit of blind luck will
help you out of this ordeal.  {x
51488.name: {RL{rost {wWithin {8the {yS{wt{8u{wm{yp {cB{8o{tg{x

description: {cThe bog water is deep here, as thick as orc's blood and perhaps
just as appealing.  Floating on top is a layer of green muck that
gathers and parts with the motions of the water.  All around you, a
damp fog passes and carries with it the stench of rotten trees.  {x
51474.name: {8The {yS{wt{8u{wm{yp {cB{8o{tg{x

description: The broad, dusty Long Road stretches out before you, well traveled
by merchants and farmers on their way to markets along the way.  The
occasional adventurer also travels here, on his way to adventures and
lost treasure in the wilderness of the North.
51542.name: {8The Open Road {c>{8-{WT{whe {WL{wong {WR{woad{8-{c<{x

description: The Long Road makes a slight bend here, leading off to the east and
south.  Nearby to the west lies the Westwood in the foothills of the
Sword Mountains.  To the east lies nothing but plains and hills for as
far as you can see.
51517.name: {8Along the {gGrasslands {c>{8-{WT{whe {WL{wong {WR{woad{8-{c<{x

description: The Long Road continues through the grasslands with very little to
see in the way of scenery.  An occasional passerby will grace you with
their presence, but most keep to themselves as the times require.  Far
to the west is a forest just under the shadow of mountains, though
from here, it would be quite a walk to reach them.
51518.name: {8Along the {gGrasslands {c>{8-{WT{whe {WL{wong {WR{woad{8-{c<{x

description: {gThe Ancient Keep rises to the north with walls too steep to climb.
The trees nearby are young, as many centuries ago they were cleared
out to prevent the enemies from using them as climbing poles.  {x
51581.name: {wW{ci{8th{ci{wn {GKe{gep {cW{goo{Gds{x

description: The monotonous scenery makes for a dull journey.  Perhaps it would
have been nice to bring along a minstrel, as some good music would be
a nice change to the silence.  Grasslands stretch to the east and
dance in unison to the whims of the winds.
51411.name: {8Along the {gGrasslands {c>{8-{WT{whe {WL{wong {WR{woad{8-{c<{x

description: {g
{gYou{w come {yupon a f{8lat, sto{gne{8 platfor{ym slight{wly rai{gsed
{gfro{wm the {yblanket {8of leave{gs.{8 A close{yr look r{weveals{g it
{gis {wthe ro{yof of an{8 ancient{g K{8eep that{y sits lo{wst wit{ghin
{gthe{wse str{yange woo{8ds.  Tho{gug{8h shatte{yred and {wno lon{gger
{gin {wuse, t{yhis Keep{8 is quit{ge {8a site n{yonethele{wss. Al{gong
{gthe{w edges{y the Kee{8p opens {gto{8 the ins{yide alon{wg seve{gral
{gdoz{wen pil{ylars of {8stone, t{gho{8ugh curr{yently it{w seems{g to
{ghav{we coll{yapsed ba{8rring th{ge {8way in i{yn a pile{w of st{gone.{x
51410.name: {wT{8he {yA{gn{yc{gi{ye{gn{yt {cK{8ee{cp {8of {cR{wa{css{wa{cl{wa{cnt{wa{cr{x

description: {gThe wind blows gently from the west, rustling the trees in a
synchronized dance of silent reverence.  Perhaps these ancient woods
haven't seen someone like you in many hundred years, for there seems
no signs that anyone else has intruded on them in recent times.  {x
51571.name: {wW{ci{8th{ci{wn {GKe{gep {cW{goo{Gds{x

description: This is the closest that the Long Road comes to Lurkwood, and just
within lies the settlement of Grunwald.  Though a bit off the beaten
path, many travelers make their way to this village for safe haven, as
the well renouned Thunderbeast tribe resides there.
51419.name: {8Near {gL{yu{grkw{yoo{gd {GF{gorest {c>{8-{WT{whe {WL{wong {WR{woad{8-{c<{x

description: The broad, dusty Long Road streches out before you, well traveled
by merchants and farmers on their way to markets along the way.  The
occasional adventurer also travels here, on his way to adventures and
lost treasure in the wilderness of the North.  You travel over the
open plains now.  Far west is the Kryptgarden Forest and to the east
is nothing but open land for as far as you can see.
51527.name: {8Near the {yFoothills {c>{8-{WT{whe {WL{wong {WR{woad{8-{c<{x

description: The ominous edges of the Craggs rise to the northwest just in
eyesight.  The Long Road cuts into them further north.  To the east,
the dark forests of Lurkwood close in as if to beckon travelers to
them.
51422.name: {8Near {gL{yu{grkw{yoo{gd {GF{gorest {c>{8-{WT{whe {WL{wong {WR{woad{8-{c<{x

description: {8The air is rather clean smelling given that this is an animal tent.
The ground is broken in near all places and the tent poles are knocked
over at odd angles, barely keeping the tent off the ground.  It
appears that whatever lives here does so against it's own free will.  {x
51596.name: {WI{8nside {xa {RL{rarge {YT{yent{x

description: {cYou find yourself in a most unusual place in the Stump Bog.  All
around you are walls of trees, and just a few small pools of murky
water gather in places.  It is almost like a path leading eastward,
and you are compelled to see what is at the end.  {x
51482.name: {8The {yS{wt{8u{wm{yp {cB{8o{tg{x

description: The Sword Mountains loom just to the northwest, the grasslands to
the east, a small hamlet to the south, and to the north lies the
Village of Amphail.  The well-worn road assumes an easy surface for
carts and horses, though for foot traffic, the middle stretch of
softer earth is preferred.
51565.name: {8Near the Mountains {c>{8-{WT{whe {WL{wong {WR{woad{8-{c<{x

description: {cThe sounds echo all about and in the distance you can hear the
moans of the undead being carried upon the fog from the river
Dessarin.  The marsh water is just under waist deep here, and there
are many strange things inside, so a careful adventurer would be wise
to bring a spell of flying along to save the discomfort.  {x
51449.name: {wDeep {8in the {yS{wt{8u{wm{yp {cB{8o{tg{x

description: {gThe woods extend far to the west, and this section seems to be
isolated by the everlooming Keep to the east.  The creatures here look
more fantastic than those previously, though perhaps a bit stronger as
well.  {x
51498.name: {wFar {wW{ci{8th{ci{wn {GKe{gep {cW{goo{Gds{x

description: {gFar into the Keep Woods, the sounds of the world fade into nothing.
These quiet woods are the perfect place to find solace and to lull
away the cares of everyday life.  {x
51575.name: {wFar {wW{ci{8th{ci{wn {GKe{gep {cW{goo{Gds{x

description: {y A small, barren area is here between the tents that has been
trampled by past visitors such that the ground is hard and littered
with trash.  A kid stands in front of both tents diligently doing the
job he was hired to do.  Above the northern tent is a sign bearing the
name "Suglios' House of Chance" with two white cubes and a stack of
platinum tickets.  To the west is a large tent built against several
of the larger carts, which you recognize as being used for
transporting prisoners and live game.  {x
51597.name: {gI{8n {gF{8ront {xof the {YT{yents{x

description: The broad, dusty Long Road stretches out before you, well traveled
by merchants and farmers on their way to markets along the way.  The
occasional adventurer also travels here, on his way to adventures and
lost treasure in the wilderness of the North.  To the west you see
rolling hills, but to the east is only vast plains.
51545.name: {8The Open Road {c>{8-{WT{whe {WL{wong {WR{woad{8-{c<{x

description: Here the stream meanders sharply southeast as it descends a
foothill.  From here, you can see the ominous dark scar that is the
Stump Bog, rising just in front of the Dressarin River.  North and
south of you are more rolling foothills that grow into the Sword
Mountains to the west.
51461.name: {WF{wollowing {8A {CS{ct{8re{ca{Cm{x

description: Before you to the northwest is the stone walls of Mirabar.  The
Long Road ends to the north here, as it reaches the massive gates of
the outer wall.  As Mirabar is encircled with several of these stone
walls, this is but one of the gates to the inside.  This large gate is
called the River Gate, as it borders the Mirar River.
51440.name: {8At the {wGates {cof {YM{yi{gr{Ga{gb{ya{Yr {c>{8-{WT{whe {WL{wong {WR{woad{8-{c<{x

description: Passing the dark forests of Lurkwood, you hear strange sounds of
animals, and perhaps humanoids lurking within.  To the west, the
grasslands end abruptly as a large range of craggy hills rise further
northwest.
51418.name: {8Near {gL{yu{grkw{yoo{gd {GF{gorest {c>{8-{WT{whe {WL{wong {WR{woad{8-{c<{x

description: The tunnel is roughly dug out, perhaps with primitive tools, for
there are rocks that were never dug up.
51444.name: {8a small tunnel{x

description: The Long Road continues northward as it passes Lurkwood to the
east.  The jagged rocks of the Grags rise sharply to the northwest,
and it appears the road will intersect it shortly.
51425.name: {8The Open Road {c>{8-{WT{whe {WL{wong {WR{woad{8-{c<{x

description: {cIn a narrow passageway of steep cliffs and large stumps, you tread
through the bog in search of something you're not sure about.  It is
such blind flights of fancy that many an adventurer lost their life
for, but it is the motivation that there are many with such flights
who became written in legend that keeps you going.  {x
51470.name: {8The {yS{wt{8u{wm{yp {cB{8o{tg{x

description: {cA wall of trees gather here, concealing the wretched state of this
place from the rest of the realms.  The Stump Bogs are for most sane
minds anything but hospitable, which makes this an asylum for those
not blessed with sanity.  A favorite stomping ground for criminals,
monsters, and general undesirables of the civilized realms.  {x
51477.name: {8The {yS{wt{8u{wm{yp {cB{8o{tg{x

description: {gThe wind shuffles some leaves here, but few creatures stir at the
commotion.  They have lived in peace for so long, it is hard for them
to imagine someone is actually here to harm them.  {x
51574.name: {wFar {wW{ci{8th{ci{wn {GKe{gep {cW{goo{Gds{x

description: The tunnel comes to an abrupt halt here.  There is small trickles
of light coming from above through a cover of leaves and twigs.
51445.name: {8a small tunnel{x

description: There are a few tables spaced here on loosely fitted timbers.  A
few windows open towards the Hamlet to the west, offering a view of
the Long Road.  At the back of the Tavern are where the rooms are kept
51554.name: {YThe Sle{yep{Ying Dr{yag{Yon Ta{yve{Yrn{x

description: {gA few flowers bloom here in a small clearing of the canopy.  They
seem untouched by anything, including others intruding on their home.
Within this forest, one could hide from pursuit and have a good chance
of not being found.  Hopefully, no one else has already thought of
that.  {x
51403.name: {wW{ci{8th{ci{wn {GKe{gep {cW{goo{Gds{x

description: {gThe woods continue here without end, as if there wasn't one.  The
Long Road, though you know it to be to the east, is now very much
hidden from view.  You can faintly hear the sounds of a caravan
rolling along, which suggests it is not that far away.  {x
51408.name: {wW{ci{8th{ci{wn {GKe{gep {cW{goo{Gds{x

description: The road goes on through the eastern foothills of the Sword
Mountains.  To the south it approaches the small hamlet Rassalantar,
and it makes a sharp turn to the east before leading north again
towards Amphail Village.  Far to the east you can catch a glimpse of
the the foggy marsh, The Stump Bog.
51508.name: {8North of {cR{wa{css{wa{cl{wa{cnt{wa{cr {c>{8-{WT{whe {WL{wong {WR{woad{8-{c<{x

description: {y
This room is set up for the members and guests to take some
time out and relax while waiting for the next expedition to
hunt a trophy. There's a ratty old couch sitting next to an
old stone fireplace, with a few people standing around here.{x
51589.name: {yLodge {WC{wommons{x

description: {gThe Keep Woods seem much larger than they were when you stood by
them just moments ago.  There are no paths, just endless rows of trees
and thick brush that suggests few people actually take the time to
walk through here.  You wonder why you did.  {x
51564.name: {wW{ci{8th{ci{wn {GKe{gep {cW{goo{Gds{x

description: {y
This small building houses an independent game hunting group
which flourishes from the pelt trade along the Long Road. It
is here that traders first stop with their trophies in order
to barter a higher price, though this lodge has a reputation
for being picky and their method of payment is rather sketch.{x
51588.name: {8A {BSmall {rH{wu{Rn{Wt{Ri{wn{rg {yLodge{x

description: {cOn the edge of the Stump Bog, there seems to be no less of a supply
of icky things than there were before.  You wonder what sort of
secrets this place has yet to hide, but know one think it does offer
is a quick way to death.  With caution, you look back towards the bogs
and contemplate returning.  {x
51481.name: {8The {yS{wt{8u{wm{yp {cB{8o{tg{x

description: You reach a high point along the Grags as your view of the west and
east opens up to the hilly terrain.  To the southeast, the vast forest
of Lurkwood stretches well into the continent.  To the far north, the
town of Mirabar can be seen in all its glory, and behind it looms the
Spine of the World.
51433.name: {8Across the {wG{yr{ca{yg{ws {c>{8-{WT{whe {WL{wong {WR{woad{8-{c<{x

description: This small hole stinks, and no doubt due to what's in it.  Before
you is a rather fat half orc that sports a silly grin at his visitor.
Maybe you should break for the door while you still have a chance.
51583.name: {8A {rSmelly {yHole{x

description: The Long Road makes its way northwest towards the Xantharis Keep
and much further north, the city of Mirabar.  For many traders, this
is their final stop, as southern goods fetch high prices there, and
likewise for their goods being sought after in the south.
51407.name: {8The Open Road {c>{8-{WT{whe {WL{wong {WR{woad{8-{c<{x

description: The broad, dusty Long Road streches out before you, well traveled
by merchants and farmers on their way to markets along the way.  The
occasional adventurer also travels here, on his way to adventures and
lost treasure in the wilderness of the North.  West of you you can see
the northern end of the Sword Mountains, and to the east is nothing
but hills
51532.name: {8The Open Road {c>{8-{WT{whe {WL{wong {WR{woad{8-{c<{x

description: {w
The walls extend outward into the forest in a decent drop
down on an overhang, making it impossible for invaders to
climb up without using ladders or felled trees. But those
on top of the Keep could rather easily jump down to melee.
51493.name: {wT{8he {ySh{gat{8t{ger{yed {cK{8ee{cp {8of {cR{wa{css{wa{cl{wa{cnt{wa{cr{x

description: {cYou walk along deep inside the Swamp Bog with no way to gauge which
way is which.  Perhaps instinct and a bit of blind luck will help you
out of this ordeal.  {x
51484.name: {RL{rost {wWithin {8the {yS{wt{8u{wm{yp {cB{8o{tg{x

description: In this intersection the road from Waterdeep splits into two roads.
The High Road leads west along the coast and passes on the west side
of the Sword Mountains on its way north.  The Long Road leads north
from here and takes the inland route east of the mountains.  The tall
peaks of the Sword Mountains can be seen not far to the North.
51502.name: {8At an Intersection {c>{8-{WT{whe {WL{wong {WR{woad{8-{c<{x

description: Here, the Long Road begins to make its way to the northwest,
curving into some foothills far to the north.  Directly west is
nothing but flatlands and grassy plains and to the east is the same,
though there is some hill country within eyesight.  The tiring journey
along this road is further grounded in the monotonous scenery that
accompanies it.
51406.name: {8The Open Road {c>{8-{WT{whe {WL{wong {WR{woad{8-{c<{x

description: {w
The stone outlook is blanketed with dead leaves and branches
and small puddles of stagnant water gather in the cracks. On
all sides, a small notched wall surrounds the inner overlook
protecting defenders and allowing for archers to fire safely.{x
51496.name: {wT{8he {ySh{gat{8t{ger{yed {cK{8ee{cp {8of {cR{wa{css{wa{cl{wa{cnt{wa{cr{x

description: The Village of Amphail lies to the north amidst several clusters of
farms and outskirt settlements.  The dense grasslands of Dessarin lies
not far to the east, with some craggy outcrops of stone lying nearby.
A gentle breeze blows from the east, no doubt from the coast of the
Sea of Swords which is blocked from view by the mountains.
51559.name: {8The Open Road {c>{8-{WT{whe {WL{wong {WR{woad{8-{c<{x

description: The road goes on through the eastern foothills of the Sword
Mountains.  To the east it approaches Amphail Village which lies not
far to the north-east from here, and it makes a sharp turn to the west
here before leading south again towards Rassalantar and Waterdeep.
51510.name: {8Near the Mountains {c>{8-{WT{whe {WL{wong {WR{woad{8-{c<{x

description: {w
Standing outside on the open outlook of Rassalantar's Keep,
you can see out into the forest from a ways away. The large
trees still tower above the outlook as they have long since
aged beyond its years, but they still hold a defensive edge.{x
51494.name: {wT{8he {ySh{gat{8t{ger{yed {cK{8ee{cp {8of {cR{wa{css{wa{cl{wa{cnt{wa{cr{x

description: There are a few farms scattered to the east, and to the north is a
fairly good sized village.  The west is mostly barren, with a few
trees overshadowed by the peaks of the Sword Mountains.
51512.name: {8Near the Mountains {c>{8-{WT{whe {WL{wong {WR{woad{8-{c<{x

description: {gThis far into the Keep Woods, there is little trace of civilization
aside from the towering ruins of the Keep to the east.  The air is
alive with many fantastic creatures, some big, some small, and some
you have never seen before.  {x
51499.name: {wFar {wW{ci{8th{ci{wn {GKe{gep {cW{goo{Gds{x

description: {gThe tall trees overshadow the woods in a dark canopy, which gives
them almost an ominous feel.  Though they call these woods, they seem
more like a forest in density, though perhaps woods are named more for
their size than their content.  {x
51579.name: {wFar {wW{ci{8th{ci{wn {GKe{gep {cW{goo{Gds{x

description:
Gharosia the trader is a bulky human male who sits behind his booth
polishing a set of bronzed horns.  He seems uninterested in you or
anyone else for that matter, unless of course they bring him some game
trophies, in which case he will pay our according to the sign on the
booth.  {x 
{x
The payout is on the sign.  Give him the item and he'll pay you in the
appropriate amount.  If you give him something you decide later you
wish to keep, just mention that you want him to {Mdrop it{x and he'll
most likely do so.

description:
This nasty leech is very quick and agile, and gets its name from
its act of attacking the neck of its prey first.

description:
He is a rather husky human, with a physique barely fit to walk this
road ten feet without breaking a sweat, yet he is here.  His
motivation is no doubt cold platinum, for his boss Verbek is loaded to
the gills.
51505.name: {GF{cr{8e{ci{gd{co{8l{ci{Gn{x~

description:
{0The innkeeper is {YT{yhru{Yn {D'Sp{wid{Der' {YS{yama{Yll{yaha{Yn{0, a short and stocky
middleaged man.  He looks like a good host who always has a warm fire
and a tankard of ale ready for cold guests.
51500.room_name: An innkeeper stands here, ready to welcome new guests.
51500.name: {YT{yhru{Yn S{yama{Yll{yaha{Yn{0~

description:
This young boy is a local to the hamlet that makes a living working
in the inn, which many other boys wish they did.  His job is to clean
the rooms and keep the patrons in order for Thrun.
51501.room_name: A tavern boy is here cleaning up
51501.name: a tavern boy~

description:
This young girl makes a living in the Sleeping Dragon selling
drinks and waiting on the patrons.  Though she seems frail and
innocent, barlife has tempered her into a grizzled entity, and her
manners leave something to be desired.
51502.room_name: A tavern girl is here waiting on patrons.
51502.name: a tavern girl~

description:
This stranger wears a long cloak as most travelers prefer in these
parts.  He has a small pouch and a tankard of ale in front of him, and
seem to mind his own business.

She makes her living waiting on patrons here in the tavern, though

description: This turtle looks like a rock and tries to hide like one too.
51528.name: {xa {8rock {gt{8u{grt{8l{ge{x~

F for AHMV
F par ABCDEFGHIJK

description:
He is a tall, slender man in his late 50s who has embarked upon the
trade routes himself due to the unfortunate demise of his assistant,
